result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant William P. Sallander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

#1 - Victim Impact Statement.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

Not to commit any new crimes.  Must appear at all future court appearances.  Defendant shall give written notice to the Clerk of this Court within 48 hours of any changes of address or telephone number.  Defendant shall neither directly or indirectly threaten, harass, intimidate or otherwise interfere with victims or witnesses in this action.  Not to have contact with: KK DOB 03/13/07, AP DOB 5/6/10 and Amy Hughes, Not to ;be at 1977 Polk Barron St.  No firearms.

Defendant William P. Sallander in court with attorney Joel David Schlitz.  Daniel P. Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KK Clerk 2:21PM  DA Steffen states agreement between parties.  Amended Information filed.    Count 1 DJOC.   Ex 1: O/R.  Defendant enters plea of NC to Count 2 and Count 3.  Court - Accepts NC plea and finds G on Count 2 and 3.  Count 4 is DRI w/prej and w/o costs.  Count 1 is a Deferred Prosecution Agreement - Deferred Status (2 year agreement). 

Count 2 and 3 - w/hold sentence 2 years Probation.  If probation wants early discharge may petition court.  AODA and Comply with recommendations.  Absolute Sobriety is up to Probation if they feel necessary.  Compas and follow through.  Anger management assessment and comply.  NO contact with Amy Hughes and her family.  No contact with Staples Lake Bar and Residence of Amy Hughes - 2640 county road G in Emerald.  During Probation not to possess any firearms.  9 days of sentence credit at this time if revoked.  If different than Atty Schlitz to file corrected sentence credit.  Must pay $265.60 on each misd.  One DNA surcharge $200.  Remainder of bond to be refunded to poster.  PCR.  adj.  2:58PM
